entry.et: Middle English cusshin, from Anglo-French cussin, quissin, from Vulgar Latin *coxinus, from Latin coxa hip coxa

def.dt: :a soft pillow or pad usually used for sitting, reclining, or kneeling
:a bodily part resembling a pad
:something resembling a cushion: as
:pillow 2
:rat 3
:a pad of springy rubber along the inside of the rim of a billiard table
:a padded insert in a shoe
:an elastic body for reducing shock
:a mat laid under a large rug to ease the effect of wear
:something (as an economic factor or a medical procedure) serving to mitigate the effects of disturbances or disorders
:a reserve supply (as of money)
:a comfortable lead a 4–0 cushion in the ninth inning
:to seat or place on a cushion
:to suppress by ignoring
:to furnish with a cushion a cushioned seat
:to mitigate the effects of trying to cushion the blow
:to protect against force or shock cushion the ride
:to check gradually so as to minimize shock of moving parts
:hovercraft
:a scale insect (Icerya purchasi) introduced into the United States from Australia that infests citrus and other plants
:a cushion that makes a sound like the breaking of wind when sat upon
